channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ivan F. Boesky, Rogue Trader in 1980s Wall Street Scandal, Dies at 87
item.description: An inspiration for the Gordon Gekko character in the movie “Wall Street,” he made a fortune from insider trading before his downfall brought a crashing end to a decade of greed.

item.title: Live Updates: ‘Technical Failure’ Caused Helicopter Crash That Killed Iran’s President, State News Agency Reports
item.description: The deaths of Iran’s president, Ebrahim Raisi, and foreign minister left the country without two of its most influential figures at a moment of regional and domestic tumult.

item.title: Fed governor highlights de-dollarization debate as concerns of global economy dropping the dollar grow: ‘The role of the U.S. economy in world finance is changing’
item.description: Russia sanctions, Chinese central bank policy are reopening long debate over the future of dollar dominance.

item.title: Assange Can Appeal Extradition to U.S., British Court Rules
item.description: The WikiLeaks founder won his bid to appeal his extradition to the United States on espionage charges, opening a new chapter in a prolonged legal battle.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Israeli Leaders Rally Behind Netanyahu Despite Divisions Over War
item.description: The Israeli prime minister called the request by the chief prosecutor at the International Criminal Court to seek his arrest “a distortion of reality.” His supporters and some critics criticized the prosecutor, who is also seeking the arrest of three Hamas leaders.

item.title: We know very little about neurodivergent women—and they may be entirely overlooked at work
item.description: Boys are diagnosed with ADHD at a 3-to-1 ratio compared to girls. Boys are 4 times likelier to be diagnosed with autism and twice as likely with dyslexia

item.title: After Raisi’s Death, Hard-Liners Are Expected to Keep Grip on Power
item.description: The death in a helicopter crash of Iran’s president, Ebrahim Raisi, disrupts a careful effort at a smooth transition to a new supreme leader to replace the aging Ali Khamenei.

item.title: Assange Can Appeal Extradition to U.S., British Court Rules
item.description: The WikiLeaks founder won his bid to appeal his extradition to the United States on espionage charges, opening a new chapter in a prolonged legal battle.

item.title: Goldman Sachs head of strategy Mintzberg to replace Sonnenshein as Grayscale CEO
item.description: Michael Sonnenshein spent 10 years at Grayscale. He's set to step down effective Aug. 15.

item.title: After Raisi’s Death, Speculation Over Iran’s Next Supreme Leader Turns to Khamenei’s Son
item.description: Mojtaba Khamenei, 65, plays an influential role in the office of the supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, and has fostered ties within the security apparatus.

item.title: After Raisi’s Death, Hard-Liners Are Expected to Keep Grip on Power
item.description: The death in a helicopter crash of Iran’s president, Ebrahim Raisi, disrupts a careful effort at a smooth transition to a new supreme leader to replace the aging Ali Khamenei.

item.title: Wall Street titan, who inspired Gordon Gekko's 'greed is good' screed before being banned in one of the biggest financial scandals and sentenced to prison, has died
item.description: “Greed is all right, by the way,” Ivan Boesky told graduates of the University of California at Berkeley’s business school in 1986, months before his downfall. “I want you to know that. I think greed is healthy. You can be greedy and still feel good about yourself.”

item.title: Legalized Weed is Landing More Seniors in the E.R.
item.description: In Canada, cannabis poisonings rose sharply among people 65 and older after the country legalized the drug, a new study found.

item.title: After Raisi’s Death, Speculation Over Iran’s Next Supreme Leader Turns to Khamenei’s Son
item.description: Mojtaba Khamenei, 65, plays an influential role in the office of the supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, and has fostered ties within the security apparatus.

item.title: The damaged ship that caused Baltimore's deadly bridge collapse has been escorted back to port—a major milestone in the recovery effort
item.description: Nearly two months have passed since the Dali crashed into the bridge, killing six construction workers and halting most traffic through the Port of Baltimore.
